items.summary: Create a new file `frontend/src/components/ProApp.tsx` as a fully self-contained React component (no React Router, no external navigation libs). It must include all pro-space screens and sub-components inline or imported locally: Dashboard, Radar, Wallet, Business, Subscription Modal, and Subscription Success animation. Navigation between these screens must be driven exclusively by `useState`. The component must export `ProApp` as a default export.

In `frontend/src/components/ProApp.tsx`, define a color constants object `C` that includes the value `t4: '#2E2E3E'`. Use `C.t4` for the `IconCamera` fill color and for all other very subtle/discrete UI elements (placeholder text, dividers, inactive icon strokes, secondary backgrounds, etc.).

In `frontend/src/components/RoleSelection.tsx` (or `RoleSelectionV2.tsx`, whichever is currently active in ScreenRouter), replace the navigation target for the 'Professionnel' role selection with a render of `<ProApp />`. The old broken pro space component must no longer be rendered when the user selects 'Professionnel'. Import ProApp from `./ProApp` and render it in place of the previous pro route/component.
